author: Bjarte Aune Olsen
comment: I have too many problems with errors in the logs for this to be a proper solution. The app uploads more than one log file for each trip, and splits the trip into several <trkseg> in the gpx files. Usually all the data is there (at least as far as I can see), but I have to manually edit the gpx files every single time to get the desktop app to accept them. I will instead look for another app to log my trips and create the gpx files and use your excellent desktop app to tag the photos. – EDIT: I now realised your desktop app doesn't accept GPX files from other apps than your own. So I'm using GPS Logger for Android and GeoSetter for Windows instead.

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Hello Bjarte. I am sorry it doesn't work as expected. We'll have a look at your points.

author: Kenneth Jones
comment: I thought I was purchasing a geotag app. Once I paid the small amount it asked for another nine pounds. I paid that and the app doesn't even tag my photos with MGRS coordinates.  Very disappointing and fell ripped off.

author: Darin Brown
comment: Won't geotag existing photos which is the whole reason I downloaded it. Why do I need an app on my phone to geotag photos I take on my phone? Just turn on location services. Waste of time.

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Sorry it didn't meet your expectations. The app only does, what is advertised.

author: Hans Berger
comment: Works perfectly.  Not too much power consumption, very quick tagging. Much better than the Panasonic app I used before.

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Thank you!

comment: Bit sceptical at first, but it does exactly as described and very accurately.  Wish I knew about it and purchased it sooner.

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: We're glad you like it. :)

author: Kenn Tan
comment: Google decides to break the KML format and you can't use it in Lightroom now. Lucky I found this app. It is smart and won't deplete battery like other apps.

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Thanks a lot for your review.

comment: Nach erstem App-Update waren alle bis dahin aufgenommenen Trips gelöscht. Von den übrigen Trips wurde bei ca. 50 von 800 Fotos ein Standort zugeordnet. Eine Vielzahl hiervon allerdings falsch...

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Could you please write us on helpme@tappytaps.com and further specify the issue? Thanks

author: Brandon Gaona
comment: I use this app everytime I use my mirrorless cameras. It works almost every time and with ease. The only problem is it makes my galaxy s7 edge very hot and kills the battery pretty quickly, it also freezes and requires a force close every so often. But overall does exactly what it is supposed to and am reasonably happy with it.

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Hello Brandon. Thank you for your review and feedback. The upload might take a while if the trip was a very long one or the connection is poor. Do you possible think it could be the issue? If not, please write me on adam.ludvik@tappytaps.com, we'll figure it out. Thanks.

author: Ramiro Garcia
comment: I bought the full version and it has a strange bug that I never noticed in the free version. Once the phone is locked the accuracy lowers a lot and the tracking points go from every 10 seconds to about 40 seconds. Waking up the device causes de app to work flawlessly. Not sure if it's the OS (Android 7.0) that takes cycles away from the app or what. But it definitely tracks time different with the screen off and on

author: Sean Thurston
comment: I've used the Pro v.1 app for years and have always raved how great it is for the function. This is no exception. Nice work. For less than a good cup of coffee, is worth the upgrade. Edit: as of June 2016 all I get is crashes. LG G4. I'm going back to version 1 it never failed me and the functionality was flawless.

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Hello. Does it still appear? There was some power outage at the severs, but it should be alright. If not please write on support@tappytaps.com. Thanks.

title: 5 stars to less

author: Foil Cap
comment: The desktop app cannot be opened by Mac OSX without changing the security settings to allow applications from any source. Changing this setting defeats one of the main advantages and reasons to use Apple products: security, protection against malware. Even if you change the security settings and open the app, it asks for additional open source packages. The whole installation process looks very unprofessional. If you cannot do it right on Apple products - don't offer the product on that platform.

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Hello Vlad. We worked on it for the past couple weeks and it should work now. Try downloading the new desktop version from the web and let us know if you're sattisfied. Have a nice day.

author: Paul Coles
comment: Fantastic GPS tagging app. Works really well, doesn't destroy the battery. You can do a log per day, or just keep pausing and recording, it's all sorted by day in the gpx file.   I load the tracks into Lightroom, so I can't comment on any of the other functionality.

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Thank you very much for your review.

author: Judith Ferdman
comment: I have purchased the previous version and now would like to purchase the newest version but it only allows me pay the FULL price.  I have reached out to customer support of which they claim it is a Google issue.  I have reached out to Google and they say it is the app's developer problem.  Please help - does anyone else have this problem? I can't rate an app if I can't use it.

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Hello Judith, we are sorry you're having difficulties regarding our app. Can you write me on adam.ludvik@tappytaps.com. Write me which version you have and we'll figure it out.

author: Airlie Andrews
comment: The comments below was how I first felt. But now it has stopped, I have uninstalled, reinstalled, cleared cache and data, but it just says 'unfortunately geotag has stopped working. I have been asking for help for 3 days now, no response. SO MY ADVICE NOW IS SAVE YOUR MONEY AND LOOK ELSEWHERE - they take your MONEY but offer no support. These were my original comments - Easy to use. Bit confusing with the upload and getting into LR, but after a couple of goes it is easy peasy.

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Hi Airlie. We always offer our support as we'll do now to you. We just cannot do it on everyday basis. We'll look at that and figure the problem out. We certainly don't intend to take your money for an app that does not work properly.

title: Was Loving it BUT NOT NOW

author: Manolis Stamatogiannakis
comment: I like the app but I'm doubting its robustness. Recent (June 2016) server-side problems resulted in the app not starting (crashing with no helpful message). This was a source of great frustration for me, as I happened to be on a trip and relied on the app to be working to have my photos tagged. At the price of this app, I'd expect a graceful service degradation. I.e. the app should still work, but syncing should be deferred. When this has been implemented, I'll gladly raise my rating of the app.

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Hello. Does it still appear? There was some power outage at the severs, but it should be alright.

comment: I really wanted it to work without internet. I succeeded twice, but there were errors in where I had travelled. One trip "cpap" was there with erroneous distances and then it was gone...too bad.  Thank you for the trial.  Jlo

author: Luís Veloso
comment: After instalation the application keeps crashing. I sent severals reports in the last hour regarding the crashes. Hope they solve this because the application has good features.  I am using the LG G3.

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Hello Luís. Has it been successfully resolved?

author: Gary Walmer
comment: I'm very disappointed in this app. I tried the free version and it worked beautifully, so I bought it. I did two photo trips and the tagging was spotty. I discovered that was my fault because I forgot to reset the camera date/time to allow for daylight saving time. So...I got it changed and all synced.   I just went on another photo tour. I did not get a single tab even though the desktop app said it had tagged all photos. Some of these locations I stumbled across so did not have addresses for them. I counted on GeoTag to tell me where I was at the time. Very disappointed!  UPDATE: I just discovered you can change the time on the photos to match the difference from the phone. So I went back and tried to re-tag all photos from the days I had the time on camera wrong. NOTHING!  This App Is No Good!

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Hello Gary. Sorry that you have a disappointing experience with the app. Our support is there on support@tappytaps.com to help you.

author: Mike Newman
comment: This app pretends to be a professional gps geotagging app but unfortunately it doesn't do a professional job. It fails to track you accurately and plonks geo-positions all over the place often hundreds of metres away from the track you actually walked along.   It's only useful if you want to know which county you're in, more-or-less, and will tend to lumps great wads of your photos in the same location.  Sorry, but I regret that I paid for this. I'm now using Geo Tracker (which is a bit basic) and I'm learning ViewRanger GPS (not entirely intuitive but I'm getting there).

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Hello Mike. If you write us on helpme@tappytaps.com and tell us which devices you're using, we'll be able to figure it out.

author: Andreas
comment: Keeps my phone awake all the time, the old app did not do this. Still missing option to always geotag (i.e. start automatically after reboot) and constantly notifies me, when upload was done. Please add option to hide this. Also, do you expect me to pay again, after already paying for the old app? Like the new design though. //Update: mailed dev a while ago, no answer, two updates, still nothing fixed, so I have to take away a star :( //still

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: HI Andreas, we are really sorry you are not satisfied with our new app. Could you please send me more details about your issue, so our developer can fix it? Please let me know at jakub.snorbert@tappytaps.com and I will do my best to help you.

title: Old app is better atm

author: Steph Parker
comment: The Linux desktop version doesn't work under Ubuntu and the test run of the recorder not only didn't upload the .gpx to Dropbox it didn't save it on the phone. There are enough utilities on Linux to geotag photos from a .gpx and there are better, and cheaper, .gpx recorders.

author: Tom Wong
comment: I have used this apps many times but suddenly i cant open the apps and then cannot download my gps location whose are my important thing about my life......

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Hello. Does it still appear? There was some power outage at the severs, but it should be alright. If not please write on support@tappytaps.com. Thanks.

title: Cant open the apps to retrieve my important gps location....

author: José Oliver-Didier
comment: The app does the job. However, I would give it 5 stars if it had a a way to add "points of interest"/"waypoints". For example, when I travel I like to add the place name to my photos it would be nice if the app would allow to add place name location or integrate using a location source such as foursquare or Facebook.

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Hello José, thank you for your review and your feedback. ♥ We'll look at that.

title: Great app.

comment: Great app.  Best I have ever used.  Very accurate.  Much cheaper than buying a dedicated GPS for my camera.  The GPX file created can be used with many Geotag programs on my PC.  Geotag Photos 2 has saved me time and money.  Great job TappyTaps.

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Great review, thank you very much for it. ♥ Have a wonderful day, James.

title: THE BEST

author: Charles Wong
comment: I don't know if I'm doing something wrong but after I start recording a trip, the app dies after a few minutes (it's not running in the background anymore) and I need to reload it manually and restart the recording.  Also, where can I find the gpx files that the app generates?

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Hi Charles, could you please check if your device doesn't have some battery saving functions or if you're not running an application with this functionality? (e.g. some Huawei devices have these savings automatically enabled) If you need any further help, please contact us at helpme@tappytaps.com.

author: Dick Wolfe
comment: Paid for installation but when I try to log in I'm told password etc. not correct. Help and I will change rating

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Hello, we are sorry to hear that you are having these issues. Please contact us at support@tappytaps.com and we will do our best to help you solve this problem.

title: Need someone to contact me

author: Trent
comment: Fantastic app, the best I have found for geo tagging photos. Works perfectly with Samsung S6. The desktop app is also prefect...why spend hundreds on a on camera unit when your phone is free and in your pocket anyway?

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Thank you very much for your review.

author: Amr Eldib
comment: This is now a must have during any of my camera trips. My camera doesn't have a GPS, and this app resolved the problem very well. The mobile app is beautiful and easy to use. The desktop app is simple and does the job well

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Hi Amr, thank you for your review and for using our application. ♥

title: Works very well

author: Xie Weiqing
comment: It automatically stops Everytime....

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Hi Xie. There was an outage on the servers, but it shoul be okay now. If you have any problem, contact me on adam.ludvik@tappytaps.com. Thanks

title: Nexus 6p always crashes

author: Maxime Gratton
comment: When I tried using it, my trajectory was sporatic.

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Hello Maxime. Please try contacting us on support@tappytaps.com. If you specify the problem and tell us which device you're using, there's a very good chance we'll be able to help you.

author: Martin Vines
comment: Development team very responsive in fixing problems with ap

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Thank you, Martin. We appreciate clients' communication.

author: Daniel Lisboa
comment: I use it with Lightroom via Google Drive and it works fine! The user interface is very well designed!

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Hi Daniel, thank you for your review and for using our application. ♥

title: Very good!

author: Ash L
comment: ...given the number of higher rated free apps that achieve the same goal.
title: $10 in app purchase seems a bit rich......

author: Shmulik Shuster
comment: Great and cheap alternative to gps module

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Hi Shmulik, thank you for your review and for using our application. ♥

author: Giang Nuyg
comment: Does what needed

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Thanks. :) Happy to hear that.

title: Eady to use

author: Richard Armstrong
comment: Used this app both home and abroad and it recorded flawlessly.

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Great to hear. :)

title: Excellent App

author: Clem T.
comment: Doesn't take photo

author: Stewart Audsley-Munro
comment: Very good and cheaper than buying add on GPS for SLR

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Hello Stewart, glad you're sattisfied and thank you for your review. ♥

author: Paul Abrey
comment: Like it.

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Glad you like it, Paul.

title: Great but a little battery hungry

author: Chris Newham
comment: Great for creating a GPX file of your adventures.

reply.author: TappyTaps s.r.o.
reply.content: Thanks!
